definitions.text: an abraded area where the skin is torn or worn off
a depression scratched or carved into a surface
a competitor who has withdrawn from competition
a line indicating the location of the start of a race or a game
a harsh noise made by scraping
examples: the scrape of violin bows distracted her
a golfer who plays at scratch should be able to achieve par on a course

definitions.text: cut the surface of; wear away the surface of
scrape or rub as if to relieve itching
postpone indefinitely or annul something that was scheduled
examples: we had to scrub our vacation plans
scratch that meeting--the chair is ill

definitions.text: remove by erasing or crossing out or as if by drawing a line
examples: Please strike this remark from the record

definitions.text: gather (money or other resources) together over time
examples: She had scraped together enough money for college

definitions.text: carve, cut, or etch into a material or surface
examples: engraved the trophy cupt with the winner's
the lovers scratched their names into the bark of the tree
